results.content: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
results.author: William C. Menninger

results.content: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
results.author: Hubert Humphrey

results.content: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
results.author: Jerome

results.content: One may say the eternal mystery of the world is its comprehensibility.
results.author: Albert Einstein

results.content: We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
results.author: Albert Schweitzer

results.content: I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you're not in this world to live up to mine.
results.author: Bruce Lee

results.content: There is no failure except in no longer trying.
results.author: Elbert Hubbard

results.content: We are either progressing or retrograding all the while. There is no such thing as remaining stationary in this life.
results.author: James Freeman Clarke

results.content: There is no greater harm than that of time wasted.
results.author: Michelangelo

results.content: Ideas are the beginning points of all fortunes.
results.author: Napoleon Hill

results.content: Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know.
results.author: Pema Chödrön

results.content: If facts are the seeds that later produce knowledge and wisdom, then the emotions and the impressions of the senses are the fertile soil in which the seeds must grow.
results.author: Rachel Carson

results.content: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
results.author: Ralph Marston

results.content: Sometimes it is better to lose and do the right thing than to win and do the wrong thing.
results.author: Tony Blair

results.content: Where there is great love, there are always miracles.
results.author: Willa Cather

results.content: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
results.author: Basil of Caesarea

results.content: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
results.author: Napoleon

results.content: We respect our elders. There is wisdom that comes from experience, and I am not going to stop learning from wise counsel.
results.author: Marcia Fudge

results.content: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
results.author: Bodhidharma

results.content: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
results.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
